** Dinobot growled as he looked at Tavatron, never liking to think that he 
had been that close to a femm by his own will. But at least there had been 
no contact; also, he had gotten the point across rather well. Or so he 
hoped.  Through proximity or word, he could not tell.
But he had seen no concern on Tavatron�s part, making him question whether 
or not she had realized just what he had said�and how much will power alone 
it took him to say it. Which made him feel foolish and wonder just why he 
had bothered to say anything. But it did not matter to him, what was done 
was done, said was said. All he need do now was wait and see what the 
results would fathom out to be.

Dinobot shifted his weight on his aching legs, but a complaint he muttered 
not. It was all part of the effect that long run her on his body after 
repairing so soon, knowing that a few other faults might show up once or 
twice before his body began to settle down.
But it didn�t matter, he could stand it.
Suddenly Dinobot�s stomach growled loudly.
Except hunger.
Slightly discomforted by his digestive system voicing its need for 
sustenance, he shifted his weight, looking towards Tavatron as she looked 
away from him. His mind shifting from his hunger to the problem at hand, his 
mind almost seeming to be wheeling once again.
She looked away�what did he do wrong now?
Growling, Dinobot looked at Tavatron for a few more moments before he turned 
his transmetal reptilian head away and towards the edge of the cliff.
The wind stirring up small wisps of sand disturbed from his clawed hind 
limbs as he walked to the edge of the chert and looking down. The rock 
disappeared into the thick forest below, his entire torso over the edge so 
that his clawed hands moved over thin air.
Dinobot looked straight down, squinting and scanning the dike, which seemed 
to run up from the base of the cliff and along the small mountain stream 
leading away from the mass of rock.
This place must have been volcanic once upon a decade. His eyes glancing 
towards Tavatron as she caught but then turned as she stood and brushed 
herself off, seeing that she was finally ready to obey commands and return 
to base.
Stepping away from the edge of the cliff, and towards the direction that the 
fembot was facing.

Dinobot was just about to follow after Tavatron�s steps when he suddenly 
heard a very soft flapping coming from just below the cliff edge, looking 
over his shoulder to see a pair of butterflies� flutter and dance into the 
air. Their wings being that he heard.
They twisted and twined around each other, delicate little patterns in the 
air, both seeming as if one.
Dinobot looked at them for a continued moment, watching their dance and 
almost seeming to see something more then insects.
Suddenly his eyes seemed to be clouded as he recalled a dream, only flames 
were behind the crucified figure of Tavatron.
Hearing his own voice.
� Who did this to you.� It echoed through his mind, then Tavatrons answer, � 
You did.�
It was strange, but made sense�as well as confusing him. There were so many 
things that could be told out of just that one though, but with an easy 
shake of his head his eyes refocused on the blue sky and the flittering 
insects.

Dinobot glared at the dancing bugs in his vision, turning around and away 
from them as well as the message of his dream, moving away to follow 
Tavatron. His tail swinging up behind him and eliminating the peaceful and 
meaningful dance of the bugs, leaving their fairy dusted wings to drift upon 
the wind. Now empty and as soulless as he.

It wasn�t long until Dinobot caught up to Tavatron, striding in pace beside 
her, his face forward and expressionless�besides his usual aggressive 
vision.
He glanced at her once as they walked in silence, not even looking towards 
her as she spoke but listened intently.
Half of the reason he was out here was to hear her explanation of 
abandonment, after all.
But what Tavatron had said was wrong.
Without looking at her he replied with a flat voice.** � There is an excuse, 
perhaps not acceptable, but one none the less.�
** Whether she knew it or not, an excuse is a reason, perhaps true or not a 
reason none the less.
Tavatron�s excuse was the reason she had run away when he needed her, 
whatever that reason might be. One, however, he was eager to hear.
But enough of him speaking, it was her turn.
Though, what was that he heard from Tavatron�s mouth? Not running from her 
past any longer?
Dinobot snarled as he thought.
So, this femms excuse for escaping, her reason for running from the 
difficult situation was by cause of some sort of event or phrase from her 
past?
He growled. Oh yes, he knew the past well. Something, which did never, 
seemed to be kind to anyone in this cursed war, and also something you could 
never hide from.
One could never run from the past because it was always with you, made and 
still making you who you are. But Dinobot only growled again, watching a 
disturbed wood creature scamper through the grasses. Refusing an unholy 
strong urge to go after it.
But that was just the unstably  and ferociousness of the transmetal 2 side 
of him speaking. Simply putting that urge on hold either until this 
situation was over or another time arose.

Dinobot looked towards Tavatron a moment as she spoke again, his mind 
returning to more important matters.
Looking ahead again as the last sound drained from the femms throat.
His own voice colder then before.**

� That is, somewhat, of the reason I am here.�
